title: Continued Post Launch Support(PLS) of XMM-Newton in the UK(2007-2009)
abstractText: XMM-Newton is one of the ESA cornerstone satellite missions. The XMM-Newton Survet Science Centre(SSC) is an international collaboration involving a consortium of 10 institutes in the UK, France, Germany, Italy and Spain. The main role of the SSC in the XMM-Newton project are: to develop and maintain the XMM-Newton Science Analysis Software (ii) routine pipeline processing of all XMM-Newton scientific data. Within the INT WFC programme a total of ~1000 deep optical images have been obtained covering over 200 XMM-Newton fields mostly in 3 different wavebands or optical colours. This data can be used to decide what is causing the X-ray emission in the sky. e.g. is it caused by black holes in the centres of galaxies or is it caused by energetic activity in stars.
